data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Before taking a step backward, you must always always face forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you make it back to the starting point, it is definitely the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always the same in all directions. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step and take 7 steps to get to the starting point. Take 1 step and turn left, take 5 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If we return in the same sequence, we would take 10 steps starting at the starting point. Correct answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

An initial turn to the left begins with turning right. A second turn to the right ends with turning around. So, if you turn around, you turn around, turn around, turn right and turn left. So, if you turn around, you turn around, take 7 steps, turn right, turn right, take 7 steps, turn around and turn left. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn right means to turn right. To take 8 steps takes 8 steps. To take 9 steps takes 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around requires 8 steps. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you get there. Take 4 steps forward, they are straight ahead. Take 6 steps forward, they are straight ahead. Thus, the answer is Yes.

There are 7 steps to returning to starting point. All the steps take 3 steps but if you take 2 steps then it takes 7. So, the answer is yes.

Always face forward. When you take 2 steps backwards, you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

As the walking begins, we must always go forward and always face forward. The starting point is the same as where we started. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you have to get back to the first place you began. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Having four steps left, you travel in 6 directions back to the starting point. If you take 3 steps forward, you travel in 6 directions back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can continue like this: Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward that's 3 steps right. Then: Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right is the same as turning straight. Returning to the starting point is the same as turning right. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
No. You cannot return to the starting point by taking 10 steps, taking 9 steps and then taking 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

Any number of steps could lead to the starting point. Take 7 steps, take 9 steps or turn 2 right or right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and walk around 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right, take 1 step to the right. Take at least 4 steps back, then turn right. Then take 7 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

In the first step they say take 1 step. This means that that we are taking a step back. We may also say take 3 steps and the previous one is taken back to our starting point. So, the answer is yes.

You take around 2 steps. If you take 5 steps, you will return to the starting point (the square). If you take 3 steps, you will return to the starting point (the circle of the square). You can take around 2 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 7 steps, turn around and take 7 steps, that is 7 + 7 = 14 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you don’ t need to take any steps backwards. If you take 5 steps backwards you return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward and begin to walk forward, you will return to the starting point. If you take 3 steps backward, you will take 3 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take as many steps as your body can comfortably carry. The starting point is a point that is either facing forward or backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If the woman takes 8 steps backward, and the other woman takes 10 steps backward, the woman takes 10 steps backward and the other woman takes 10 steps forward. The woman always takes the same direction they started from, so if they go backward, the woman goes backward in her direction and that’ s where they started. In the other instruction there are 10 steps forward, and the other woman takes 10 steps forward. All of the instructions return you to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing forward starts out in a forward position. If you were facing backward then you would take 7 steps backwards. Taking 10 steps right is the same as taking 4 steps forward. This means you would have to take 10 steps right and 4 steps forward (forward). If you are facing forward then you would take 4 steps forward (short) and 2 steps left (long). This means that you would have to take 10 steps right and 4 steps forward (front). The answer is yes.
